content: Haizhao Yang | UMD Department of Computer Science Skip to main content Explore People People FacultyFaculty Awards In Memoriam Staff Dept. PhonebookFaculty Staff Students As PDF University Directory Search People Overview Name Search by name Title Search by title Location Search by location Apply Reset Haizhao Yang Affiliate Associate Professor Email: hzyangumd[.dot.]edu Location: 2211 Kirwan Hall, 4176 Campus Drive, College Park, MD, 20742-4015 Website: https://haizhaoyang.github.io/ Google Scholar: p4mxTIwAAAAJ Education: Ph.D., Stanford University, 2015 M.Sc., The University of Texas at Austin, 2012 B.Sc., Shanghai Jiao Tong University, 2010 Appointments: CS, UMIACS, AMSC Research Areas: Algorithms and Theory, AI and Robotics, High Performance and Scientific Computing, Machine Learning and Data Science Interest Areas: AI for Science, machine learning, High-Performance Computing, Applied Analysis Biography Haizhao Yang is an associate professor of mathematics and computer science at University of Maryland College Park. Prior to that, he was an assistant professor at Purdue University and the National University of Singapore, and a visiting assistant professor at Duke University from 2015 to 2017. He received a B.Sc. at Shanghai Jiao Tong University in 2010, an M.Sc. at the University of Texas at Austin in 2012, and a Ph.D. at Stanford University in 2015. His research focuses on machine learning, data science, applied and computational mathematics. He is a recipient of the National Science Foundation CAREER Award (2020), Office of Naval Research (ONR) Young Investigator Award (2022), DARPA Young Faculty Award for his contribution to deep learning and reinforcement learning.
